Message:
“Y’see, my whole life,
I’ve just always been
too smart to fail!

So, how does it feel
to fail at somethin’?”
Let me just kill you first!”

Tackling the girl to the ground
and climbing on top of her,
I taught her exactly how it felt
with my fists.

I put in all that time and effort...
only to mess up...
and lose everything...!!”

Before I knew it,
my clenched fists had
lost their strength,
tears raining down
in their place.

If the Academy throws me out...
I’ll have nowhere left to...!”

As I lost the ability to move,
the girl wrapped me in
a warm embrace.

“It’ll be alright. You have an
infinite future ahead of you.

Just keep messin’ up
and startin’ over as
many times as it takes.

One little failure isn’t
the end of the world.”

It’s okay to fail.
That was the first time I’d ever
been told such a thing,
so I found myself lifting
my head without thinking.

When I did, the girl let out
an amused laugh.

“If you’re up for it,
let’s be friends.”

The fact that I’d felt saved for
a moment by her sudden words
would be the end of my luck,

as the girl offering her friendship
was none other than Meria.
